definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
concubine/I, your servant (deprecatory self-reference for women)
direct (opposite: indirect 間接|间接[jian4 jie1])/immediate/straightforward
to receive (a visitor)/to admit (allow sb to enter)
to link/to join/to attach/connection/a link (on web page)
reception (of transmitted signal)/to receive/to accept/to admit/to take over (e.g. a factory)/to expropriate
to join up/to dock/a joint (between components)
railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align

sentences.english: Every time I call you, I got your administrative assistant.
sentences.chinese: 每次我给你打电话，都是你的助手接。

sentences.english: My father always picks me up after school.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲常开车顺便接我。

sentences.english: The author review the research progress in the reattachment of fractured tooth.
sentences.chinese: 本文对断牙再接的研究进展作一综述。

sentences.english: I'm here specially to meet you.
It really is the best nominee who connects this club.
sentences.chinese: 实在是接这一棒子的最佳人选。

sentences.english: You like to take the backhand crosscourt and to run around and hit forehands off second serves.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢打反手穿越，大范围跑动然后正手接二发。

sentences.english: At last, suggestions for improving the makeup reliability of PSC connection are put forward.
sentences.chinese: 对关于提高PSC接头上扣可靠性问题提出几点建议。

sentences.english: She refused to shoot the films and rejected any role.
sentences.chinese: 她不再接拍电影，也拒绝任何角色。

sentences.english: I drove to Kris’ office to pick up Ryan.
sentences.chinese: 我开着车来到克丽丝的办公室接莱恩。

sentences.english: The telephone had been ringing for three minutes before it was answered.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了三分钟才有人接。

sentences.english: As the car drove up to the door, he flew out to meet his son.
sentences.chinese: 当车子开到门口时，他飞也似地冲出去接他儿子。

sentences.english: I am busying washing the dishes, would you answer the phone, Tony?
sentences.chinese: 我正在洗碗，你接一下电话好吗，汤尼？

sentences.english: After he settled his life in Taipei, he sent for his parents to live together with him immediately.
sentences.chinese: 他在台北立脚以后就马上把他的父母接来一起生活了。

sentences.english: An old, in a special boarding school four grades, each week home again.
sentences.chinese: 一岁，在特殊全托学校读四年级，每星期接回家一次。

sentences.english: A continuously variable potentiometer is connected into the detector bridge network.
sentences.chinese: 在检测器桥路中，接有可调电位器。

sentences.english: The mother cat could not feed them. One by one, all the kittens died.
sentences.chinese: 母猫喂不饱小猫，它们一个接一个都死了。

definition: to connect (a cable etc)/to hook up (a device)/to resume (a conversation)/to set (a bone)
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
